Parallels.ab: vīspō aŋhuš astuuā̊ = Y19.10, VS3.33, VS5.4, VS5.7, VS8.34; ~ Y9.1, VS18.30, VS18.31, YtOhr2.2 (x2), YtOhr2.4 (x2) vīspahe aŋhə̄uš astuuatō; ~ Y19.2, Y19.4, Y57.24, VS18.16, VS18.24, YtSr8.2, YtSrH3.2, ARap2.4, KardeSrošRawan2.2 vīspəm ahūm astuuaṇtəm.

Nerangs.ab: According to the Nērang ī Āb, at this point the zōt has to gaze at the implements and at āb and gōmēz:

pas pad bun ī fragard wāzag ī pad bun ī ǰuddēwdād mraot̰ bē gōwišn bē ēstišn hamāg xūb bē nigērišn hamāg gyāg pēš gōmēz ud pas āb nigerišn pas ka nihuft ēstēd weh-iz bēd: tā yazišn sar ān ī gyāg dārišn pad šayišt nē šāyišt hamā wizand andar yazišn bēd hamčīyōn yašt nōg nābar.

"Then, whe he says the initial word of the fragard, mraōt̰, at the beginning of the J̌uddēwdād, he has to stand and gaze all (implements) carefully. Each time, first the gōmez and later the water. Then, when (the container for) gōmēz and water are covered, it is better to keep them at this place until the end of the liturgy. According to the Šayist nē-šāyist each mistake in the liturgy (has to treated) in the same way as in the Yašt Nōg-nābar."
